description: Either back-formed from, or otherwise related to, trepidation.

verbs.description: trepidate (third-person singular simple present trepidates, present participle trepidating, simple past and past participle trepidated)

entries.meaning: (uncommon, transitive) To cause to experience trepidation.
examples: […]  “A little trepidated, if not consternated, they lifted him from his close confinement and put him to bed.”
